data.title: Visit the Auchentoshan Whisky Distillery near Glasgow
data.meta_description: Auchentoshan is a whisky distillery Between Glasgow and Loch Lomond
data.text:
Whisky Types: Single Malt (Triple Distilled)

Typical Taste: Smooth & delicate, notes of vanilla, green apples & fresh citrus

Auchentoshan is a distillery Between Glasgow and Loch Lomond. Something Unique about Auchentoshan Distillery is the triple distillation which brings the ABV liquid up to 81% while double distillation usually reaches 70% ABV.

Auchentoshan produces one of the smoothest and delicate single malt scotch whisky with notes of vanilla, green apples, and fresh citrus. The products range from the Auchentoshan Classic to the bourbon and Spanish sherry cask matured 21 year old version. Auchentoshan also offers a range of limited editions such as the Auchentoshan 1957.

Situated just 20 minutes from Glasgow city centre, Auchentoshan Distillery is easy to reach by car and public transport. The distillery offers a wide range of tours starting from 6 pounds for the 60min long classic tour. Tours are usually offered between 9.30am and 5pm. Also special tours can be arranged where you can bottle your own whisky or have a look behind closed doors. The distillery also offers facilities for meetings which can be rented.

Whiskies

Auchentoshan Single Malt Classic – Sweet hints of toffee and caramel

Auchentoshan Single Three Wood – Sweet, fresh and zesty orange tastes

Auchentoshan Single Malt 18 year – Dry and rounded, grassy, apples, hints of toffee

Aberfeldy Single Malt 15 year – Biscuit, citrus and hints of peat

Opening Times: 9:30am to 5pm, special tours outside opening times possible.

Auchentoshan Distillery: A Visitors Guide to Scotland’s Whisky Gem

Established in 1823, Auchentoshan Distillery is a renowned single malt whisky producer located in the west of Scotland. The distillery sits between Glasgow and Loch Lomond, on the A82, at the foot of the Kilpatrick Hills, overlooking the famous River Clyde – once known as the Scottish gateway to the world. With a rich history and commitment to quality, Auchentoshan has rightfully deserved its reputation as “Glasgow’s Malt Whisky.”

Visitors to the Auchentoshan Distillery can expect an immersive experience as they join a behind-the-scenes tour, learning about the unique distillation process that sets Auchentoshan apart from other whisky producers. Guests to the distillery are welcome after advance booking, and a variety of tours and tastings are available to suit their interests. The visitor centre and shop, open daily from 10 am to 5 pm, provide further opportunities to explore the brand and its signature single malt whiskies.

A trip to Auchentoshan Distillery is not only a journey through Scotland’s rich whisky heritage but also a celebration of progress and diversity at the heart of the whisky experience. With stunning landscapes surrounding the distillery and a welcoming atmosphere, Auchentoshan is a must-visit destination for whisky enthusiasts and curious travellers alike.

History of Auchentoshan Distillery

Origins and Founding

Auchentoshan Distillery’s history dates back to 1817 when John Bulloch built the Duntocher distillery on the banks of the Clyde. Unfortunately, Bulloch went bankrupt soon after, but it didn’t stop his family from continuing the venture.

Evolution Over Time

In 1823, the Auchentoshan Distillery was officially established. Over the years, it has carved a distinctive niche for itself by being the only Scotch whisky distillery to triple distil all of its whisky. This commitment to tradition has allowed Auchentoshan to produce unique and outstanding products.

Notable Moments

A significant milestone in Auchentoshan’s history is their unwavering dedication to the triple distillation process. This method has enabled them to craft distinct Lowland whiskies that stand out from their counterparts.

Among the three remaining Lowland distilleries, Auchentoshan has secured its reputation as a top whisky producer. Their commitment to quality and time-honoured traditions has earned them numerous awards and recognition in the industry.

Exploring the Distillery

Tour Options and Experiences

Auchentoshan Distillery offers several tour options for visitors who want to get an insight into the production process and history of the distillery. The Auchentoshan Origin Tour is an excellent introduction to the distillery. It lasts 1 hour and costs £18. This tour includes an overview of Auchentoshan’s story, processes, and its place in the wider whisky world, concluding with a dram in the tasting lounge.

Production Process

Auchentoshan Distillery, established in 1823, is located on the mainland of Scotland, between Glasgow and Loch Lomond. This Lowlands malt distillery rests at the foot of the Kilpatrick Hills, overlooking the famous River Clyde. The distillery follows a traditional production process, which includes mashing, fermentation, distillation, and maturation.

Auchentoshan is unique among Scottish distilleries in that it employs triple distillation. This process results in a lighter and smoother spirit that sets its whiskies apart from other Lowland malts. The whisky is aged in oak casks, imparting rich flavours and a distinct character.

Tasting Room

Once you have experienced the production process and learned about the history of Auchentoshan Distillery, the final stop on the tour is the Tasting Room. Here, visitors can sample and appreciate the various expressions that Auchentoshan offers. Examples include:

DARK OAK SINGLE MALT SCOTCH WHISKY: A bold and complex expression aged in a combination of American oak, European oak, and sherry casks.

THREE WOOD: A unique blend matured in three different types of casks, resulting in a complex and rich flavour.

AUCHENTOSHAN AMERICAN OAK: A smooth and versatile whisky aged exclusively in American oak casks.

The Tasting Room offers a relaxed atmosphere where visitors can truly appreciate the craftsmanship and unique character of Auchentoshan whiskies. Here, guests can develop a deeper understanding of the nuances between different expressions, as well as discover the distillery’s wider range of products.

Enjoying Auchentoshan Whisky

Auchentoshan Distillery, established in 1823, is located on the mainland of Scotland, situated between Glasgow and Loch Lomond. This lowlands malt distillery is known for its unique and flavourful whisky, offering a range of products to suit different preferences.

Flagship Products

Auchentoshan is known for its distinct single malt whiskies, which include the following popular expressions:

Auchentoshan American Oak: Aged in first-fill bourbon casks, this whisky boasts lively citrus and coconut flavours with hints of toffee and vanilla.

Auchentoshan Three Wood: As the name suggests, this expression is matured in three different casks – American bourbon, Oloroso sherry, and Pedro Ximénez sherry – resulting in a rich, complex whisky with notes of dark chocolate, dried fruits, and spices.

Auchentoshan 12 Year Old: A well-balanced whisky with a smooth, creamy texture, featuring flavours of honey, toasted almonds, and crème brûlée with a gentle warming finish.

Limited Editions

In addition to their flagship products, Auchentoshan also releases limited edition whiskies with unique flavour profiles:

Auchentoshan Blood Oak: A limited release, matured in bourbon and red wine casks from France, highlighting flavours of black cherries, dark chocolate, and spices.

Auchentoshan Bartender’s Malt: An annual limited edition created by a team of bartenders from around the world, offering a varied and innovative flavour profile.

Food Pairings

To further enhance your Auchentoshan whisky experience, consider pairing these whiskies with complementary food items:

Auchentoshan American Oak: Pair with seafood dishes, such as smoked salmon or grilled prawns, to highlight its delicate citrus flavours.

Auchentoshan Three Wood: Complement its rich, dark fruit notes with decadent chocolate desserts or creamy blue cheeses.

Auchentoshan 12 Year Old: Serve alongside meat dishes, like roast pork or game, to accentuate its sweet, nutty profile.

Planning Your Visit

Location and Transportation

Auchentoshan Distillery is situated between Loch Lomond and Glasgow, on the A82 part of mainland Scotland, overlooking the renowned ‘River Clyde’. To reach the distillery, public transportation options are available, such as buses and trains. The closest train station to Auchentoshan Distillery is the Dalmuir railway station.

Hours and Admission Fees

For a memorable experience of whisky making, consider taking a tour at the Auchentoshan Distillery. The standard tour lasts about 1 hour and costs £18. During this tour, you will discover the distillery’s story, process, and place in the broader whisky world. The tour concludes with a dram in their tasting lounge. Visitors are welcome throughout the year, but it is always a good idea to check their official website or contact them for up-to-date information on hours and fees.
